items.biocatalyst: Alcohol dehydrogenase from Ralstonia sp. (RADH), expressed recombinantly in E. coli BL21(DE3) using pET-22b(+) vector. The enzyme was used as a purified protein for most experiments, but crude cell extract was also mentioned in previous studies.
items.concentration_determination_method: Protein concentration was determined using the Bradford method (Bradford, 1976) with bovine serum albumin as standard. Enzyme activity was also measured spectrophotometrically (U/mg).
items.concentration_unit: mg/mL (for protein concentration in assays); U/mg (for specific activity)
items.purification_method: Three-step purification protocol: (1) Size exclusion chromatography (SEC) for initial desalting of crude cell extracts, (2) anion exchange chromatography, (3) a second SEC to remove sodium chloride and adjust calcium ion concentration. All steps in TEA–HCl buffer (50 mmol/L, pH 7.5) with defined CaCl2 concentrations (0, 0.2, or 0.8 mmol/L). All purification at room temperature (20–25°C).
items.special_treatment: Addition of CaCl2 (0.2–0.8 mmol/L) during or after purification for enzyme stabilization. For storage, enzyme was kept in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol/L, pH 7.5) at -20°C, or lyophilized and stored at -20°C, or with 50% (v/v) glycerol at -20°C. Enzyme stability and activity were significantly improved by CaCl2 addition.
